instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , missing <SIGNAL>PPIVS0_S5</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
Hi,

This board no any liquid damaged. Came as GPU crashing. But it is bit weird as THE GPU stress  test passed and GPU is not getting hot and crash is screen runs weird scramble shapes and fan spinning full speed from the start.

Time to time no chime or video. I replaced the GPU but the same situation. 

Now only 2 times out of 10 it starts with high speed fan. other times high speed fan spinning and no <SIGNAL>PPIV05_SO</SIGNAL>.

PIN 14, 13 I GET 5V
<RESISTOR>R7981</RESISTOR> not getting <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_R_L</SIGNAL> coz no connectivity. so I ran a wire and now I get <SIGNAL>CPUVCCIO_SO_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3V on pin 3.

missing CPU_VCCIOSENSE_P and  CPU_VCCIOSENSE_N in <RESISTOR>R1362</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1363</RESISTOR>.


Greatly appreciate your support.


Regards

Don

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , missing <SIGNAL>PPIVS0_S5</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Hopeless for sure. Bad CPU or bad traces in the board around the GPU. I bet this is an Apple refurb board with no serial number on the RAM slot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , missing <SIGNAL>PPIVS0_S5</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Hi Duke, Thank you for your reply. I think you are right. I'll replace the CPU and see. I couldnt find SR02R chip or Stencil. Anyway I'll update you soon. Thanks Duke.
